fields.name: location_information_header
fields.content: 1. Your property

fields.name: location_why
fields.content:
Reporting your property location will help Whitman County VSP understand stewardship strategies that have been completed.

At the end of this survey you will be able to hide your location information or voluntarily choose to make it public for the VSP report.

fields.name: drag_map_info
fields.content: Please drag and zoom the map to center the map on your property.

fields.name: address
fields.prompt: _(Search by address)

fields.name: analysis_units_header
fields.content: 2. Watershed analysis unit

fields.name: analysis_unit
fields.prompt: _(Of the three VSP watershed analysis units on map (Rock, Palouse, or Snake), which unit primarily represents your farm or ranch?  All reporting for VSP will be at the watershed analysis unit scale level. Complete multiple surveys for areas that are distinctively different.)

fields.name: wetlands_header
fields.content: 3. Wetland areas

fields.name: wetlands_information
fields.content:
Description

Wetland areas are inundated or saturated by surface water or groundwater.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_wetlands
fields.prompt: _(Are there any wetlands?)

fields.name: frequently_flooded_header
fields.content: 4. Frequently flooded areas

fields.name: frequently_flooded_information
fields.content:
Description

Frequently flooded areas are subject to a 1% or greater chance of flooding every year.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_frequently_flooded
fields.prompt: _(Are there any frequently flooded areas?)

fields.name: geologic_hazard_header
fields.content: 5. Geologic hazard areas

fields.name: geologic_hazard_information
fields.content:
Description

Geologic hazard areas are susceptible to erosion, sliding, earthquakes, and other geological events.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_geologic_hazard
fields.prompt: _(Are there any geologically hazardous areas?)

fields.name: critical_aquifer_header
fields.content: 6. Critical aquifer recharge areas

fields.name: critical_aquifer_information
fields.content:
Description

Critical aquifer recharge areas have a critical effect on aquifers used for potable water.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_critical_aquifer
fields.prompt: _(Are there any critical aquifers recharge areas?)

fields.name: wildlife_conservation_header
fields.content: 7. Fish & wildlife conservation areas

fields.name: wildlife_conservation_information
fields.content:
Description

Fish & wildlife conservation areas are managed to maintain populations of fish and wildlife.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_wildlife_conservation
fields.prompt: _(Are there any fish & wildlife conservation areas?)

fields.name: residue_tillage_header
fields.content: 8. Residue and Tillage Management

fields.name: residue_tillage_information
fields.content: Please fill out the form below to report your residue and tillage management practices.

content.label: _(This section is not relevant to me. Proceed to next section.)
_(This section is not relevant to me. Proceed to next section.)

fields.prompt: _(I use a conventional tillage system)

fields.prompt: _(On how many acres do you use a conventional tillage system?)

fields.name: conventional_till_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you start using a conventional tillage system?)

fields.name: no_till
fields.prompt: _(I use residue and tillage management â€“ No Till, Strip Till, Direct Seed, 2-pass, or Mulch Till)
fields.label: _(No till/direct seed)

fields.name: no_till_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you start using residue and tillage management practices?)

fields.name: watering_facility
fields.prompt: _(I operate watering facilities)
fields.label: _(Watering facilities)

body: Watering facilities are a permanent livestock and/or wildlife watering facility for storage and/or drinking access.

fields.name: watering_facility_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many stock tanks do you operate?)

fields.name: watering_facility_datetime

fields.name: cover_crop
fields.prompt: _(I plant cover crops)
fields.label: _(Cover crops)

body: Cover crops are planted immediately after harvest, and usually consist of a small grain or legume mix.

fields.name: cover_crop_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many acres of cover crop do you plant?)

fields.name: cover_crop_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last plant cover crops?)

fields.name: mulching_quantity
fields.prompt: _(On how many acres do you use mulching?)

fields.name: mulching_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you start using mulching?)

fields.name: fish_wildlife_management
fields.content: 13. Fish & Wildlife Management

fields.name: fish_wildlife_management_information
fields.content: Please fill out the form below to report your fish & wildlife management practices.

content.label: _(This section is not relevant to me. Proceed to next section.)
_(This section is not relevant to me. Proceed to next section.)

fields.name: conservation_cover
fields.prompt: _(I have conservation cover on my property)
fields.label: _(Conservation cover)

body: Conservation cover consists of the establishment of permanent vegetative cover using native species.

fields.name: conservation_cover_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many acres of conservation cover do you have on your property?)

fields.name: conservation_cover_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last plant conservation cover?)

fields.name: grassed_waterways
fields.prompt: _(I use grassed waterways)
fields.label: _(Grassed waterways)

fields.name: grassed_waterways_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many linear feet of grassed waterways do you maintain?)

fields.name: grassed_waterways_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you start establishing grassed waterways?)

fields.name: weed_control
fields.prompt: _(I control herbaceous weeds)
fields.label: _(Herbaceous weed control)

body: Herbaceous weed control consists of removal of herbaceous weeds of light infestation by mowing.

fields.name: weed_control_quantity
fields.prompt: _(On how many acres do you control herbaceous weeds?)

fields.name: weed_control_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last remove herbaceous weeds?)

fields.name: tree_shrub
fields.prompt: _(I establish trees and shrubs)
fields.label: _(Tree/shrub establishment)

body: Tree/shrub establishment consists of planting seedlings on prepared areas or woody cuttings or whips on natural floodplain areas.

fields.name: tree_shrub_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many acres of trees and shrubs have you established?)

fields.name: tree_shrub_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you start establishing new trees and shrubs?)

fields.name: upland_habitat
fields.prompt: _(I manage upland wildlife habitats)
fields.label: _(Upland habitat management)

body: Upland wildlife habitat management consists of planting cover for food and nesting habitat.

fields.name: upland_habitat_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many acres of upland habitat do you manage?)

fields.name: upland_habitat_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last manage upland wildlife habitats?)

fields.name: additional_info_header
fields.content: 14. Almost completed!

fields.name: additional_info
fields.content:
Thank you for taking the time to voluntarily report your stewardship practices.

Information on this page will determine how your information is shared. We will report all practices at the watershed analysis unit scale, but if you are interested in having your project showcased you can give us permission below. Either way, we will be using your stewardship practice to capture how agriculture is protecting and/or restoring critical areas and maintaining the viability of agriculture.

fields.name: my_image
fields.prompt: _(Show your stewardship practices! Upload photos:)
fields.label: _(Upload photos)

fields.name: private-landowner_name
fields.prompt: _(What is your name?)

fields.name: private-use_photos
fields.prompt: _(Can Whitman County VSP highlight your photos on our website?)

fields.name: private-share_story
fields.prompt: _(Would you be willing to share your stewardship story with the public?)

fields.name: private-landowner_email
fields.prompt: _(What is your email address?)

fields.name: private-landowner_phone
fields.prompt: _(What is your phone number?)
fields.placeholder: _(Your phone number will never be shared)

content: Your Whitman County VSP Coordinators or Whitman County Cattlemenâ€™s, Wheat Growers or Farm Bureau are here to help meet your stewardship goals.
Contact a local VSP Coordinator and/or Grower Group or for more information visit: www.whitmancountyvsp.com.

Whitman County Voluntary Stewardship Program (VSP) provides an innovative approach for reporting the protection of critical areas on agriculture lands that enhance our environment through voluntary measure, while promoting agriculture viability. VSP voluntarily collects previous and on-going stewardship data from all interested landowners, which helps document VSP participation and the importance of agriculture viability.
Whitman County agriculture has an important story to tell! Help promote Whitman County agriculture by sharing your story! VSP success relies on voluntary participation by landowners!
Whitman County VSP appreciates your time sharing stewardship practices!
Click Get Started below to report your conservation practices!
